snippet: Mr. Schwendeman captured hundreds of specimens in seemingly everlasting life as the last full-time taxidermist at the American Museum of Natural History.
abstract: David Schwenderman, who was the chief taxidermist at New York's American Museum of Natural History for 29 years, dies at age 87.
lead_paragraph: Mr. Schwendeman captured hundreds of specimens in seemingly everlasting life as the last full-time taxidermist at the American Museum of Natural History.

headline.seo: David Schwendeman, Museum Taxidermist, Dies at 87
headline.main: David Schwendeman, Museum’s Chief Taxidermist, Dies at 87
